c:complexType.name: PieChart
c:complexType.c:documentation: The options documentation class of the Pie chart.

c:property.name: categoryRole
c:property.c:documentation:
The category visual role.
Each category value is represented by a slice of the pie.
The category visual role automatically binds to every dimension whose name has the category prefix.
The visual role itself is optional, yet, when unbound, a dimension with a "category" prefix is automatically created for it, and all datums will have the value null in that dimension.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:property.name: colorRole
c:property.c:documentation:
The color visual role controls the color of visual elements.
The fill color of each pie slice is the color of the corresponding color role value.
The color visual role automatically binds to every dimension whose name has the color prefix or, if none exists, the dimensions of the "category" role.
The color visual role is discrete.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:property.name: valueRole
c:property.c:documentation:
The value visual role represents the main measure.
Specifically, it controls the relative angle span of each pie slice.
The value visual role automatically binds to a single dimension whose name has the value prefix.
The value visual role is required.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:property.name: orientation
c:property.c:documentation: This chart type does not represent orientation.

c:property.name: color
c:property.c:documentation:
The first color axis options.
This axis can also be accessed by the property name color.
See for more information on the way that the color axes' properties may be accessed.

c:property.name: pie
c:property.c:documentation: The pie plot is the main plot of the pie chart, which means that its properties may be used without the "pie" property suffix.

c:property.name: innerGap
extensionPoints
c:property.c:documentation: The extension points object contains style definitions for the marks of the plot.

c:complexType.name: PieChartExtensionPoints
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The extension points of the pie chart type.
To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
extension property (ex: smallBase)
the "_" character
extension sub-property (ex: strokeStyle)
and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: smallBase_strokeStyle (see ).

c:complexType.name: PiePlot
c:complexType.c:documentation: The options documentation class of the Pie plot.

c:property.name: valuesAnchor
c:property.c:documentation:
The alignment of a value label relative to its corresponding visual element position.
Specifically, this property applies to non-linked labels.

c:property.name: valuesVisible
c:property.c:documentation: Indicates if value labels are shown next to the visual elements.

c:property.name: activeSliceRadius
c:property.c:documentation:
Increment radius of an active slice, in pixel units or as a percentage.
When the value is a string, and if it is suffixed with "%", it represents a percentage of the biggest radius that can fit in the client area of the plot.
This property is only relevant if is true.
The normal radius is the biggest radius that can fit in the client area of the plot minus the space occupied by linked labels, minus the resolved active radius and minus the resolved exploded radius.
See .

c:property.name: explodedSliceRadius
c:property.c:documentation:
Increment radius of an exploded slice, in pixel units or as a percentage.
When the value is a string, and if it is suffixed with "%", it represents a percentage of the biggest radius that can fit in the client area of the plot.
The normal radius is the biggest radius that can fit in the client area of the plot minus the space occupied by linked labels, minus the resolved active radius and minus the resolved exploded radius.
See and .

c:property.name: explodedSliceIndex
c:property.c:documentation:
The index of the exploded slice, or null, for all slices to be exploded.
The exploded slice or slices are shown exploded only when is greater than 0.

c:property.name: valuesMask
c:property.c:documentation:
The values mask used to build the text of value labels.
The mask may contain scene variable names and/or scene atom names, like in the examples:
scene variables: {category}: {value} EUR, could yield Drinks: 3.45 EUR
atom variables: {#family} - {#product}, could yield Plains - Boeing 747
The default value depends on the label style:
inside - {value}
linked - {value} ({value.percent})
The percent variable is a sub-variable of the value scene variable.

c:property.name: valuesLabelStyle
c:property.c:documentation: The style used to place value labels.

c:property.name: linkInsetRadius
c:property.c:documentation:
The length of the link line segment that is inset into a slice, in pixel units, or as a percentage.
When the value is a string, and if it is suffixed with "%", it represents a percentage of the biggest radius that can fit in the client area of the plot.

c:property.name: linkOutsetRadius
c:property.c:documentation:
The length of the link line segment that extends outwards from the slice, until it reaches the link line "elbow", in pixel units, or as a percentage.
When the value is a string, and if it is suffixed with "%", it represents a percentage of the biggest radius that can fit in the client area of the plot.

c:property.name: linkMargin
c:property.c:documentation:
The width of the space that separates the label from the end of the line segment that starts in the link elbow, in pixel units, or as a percentage.
The value of this property includes the size of the link line handle.
When the value is a string, and if it is suffixed with "%", it represents a percentage of the client width of the plot.

c:property.name: linkHandleWidth
c:property.c:documentation:
The width of the link line handle width, in em units.
The handle is the last segment of the link line, an horizontal line segment just before the label.

c:property.name: linkLabelSize
c:property.c:documentation:
The width of the columns reserved, on each side of the pie, for laying out the linked label marks.
When the value is a string, and if it is suffixed with "%", it represents a percentage of the client width of the plot.

c:property.name: linkLabelSpacingMin
c:property.c:documentation: The minimum vertical space between consecutive link labels, in em units.

c:property.name: extensionPoints
c:property.c:documentation: The extension points object contains style definitions for various visual elements of the chart.

c:complexType.name: PiePlotExtensionPoints
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The extension points of the pie plot type.
To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
plot property name (ex: pie)
extension property (ex: slice)
the "_" character
extension sub-property (ex: strokeStyle)
and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: pieSlice_strokeStyle (see ).
The extension points of the main plot of a chart may be used without the plot property name prefix. In the example, when the pie plot is the main plot, the extension point can be written as slice_strokeStyle.

c:property.name: slice
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the pie slice - the wedge mark.

c:property.name: label
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the value label mark.

c:property.name: linkLine
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the line mark that links the pie slices and the linked labels.

c:complexType.name: PieChartWedgeExtensionPoint
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The class of the Pie chart's protovis Wedge extension points.
See the associated protovis documentation at .

c:property.name: innerRadiusEx
c:property.c:documentation:
The inner radius of each slice, in pixel units or as a percentage of the outer radius.
This extension point is only defined in the pie chart's wedge mark.
